definition: habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature
(bound form) to practice/to study/habit/custom
surname Xi
accustomed to/used to/indulge/to spoil (a child)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly

sentences.english: It has become so much of a second-nature that we don't even realize it.
sentences.chinese: 甚至在不知不觉中已经习惯成自然了。

sentences.english: Familiarity deadens the sensibilities, even as connected with the gravest natural phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 习惯成自然，人们就是对于重大的自然现象也是如此。

sentences.english: It's second nature to me now, and I don't even think about it.
sentences.chinese: 习惯成自然，我现在想都不想了。

definition: habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature/same as 習慣成自然|习惯成自然
habit/custom/usual practice/to be used to/CL:個|个[ge4]
to cultivate/to raise/to form (a habit)/to acquire
old habits are hard to change (idiom)
accustomed to/used to
with familiarity you learn the trick (idiom); practice makes perfect
over time/as time passes/in the fullness of time
to drop a bad habit
to accumulate over a long period of time
customary
unfamiliar at first, but well accustomed soon enough (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 hui2 sheng1 er4 hui2 shu2

definition: effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
bad habit/vice
custom/practice (usually a regrettable one)
It is hard to change one's essential nature (idiom). You can't change who you are./Can the leopard change his spots? (Jeremiah 13:23)
